intro: Arrabidaea obovata, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and often have a distinctive hairy texture. Arrabidaea obovata is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas.
